ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Global Operations Project & Change Manager for Dentsu Aegis Network), but was not in management in the most recent role as Freelance Digital Marketing Consultant.

Positions.Description:
Guiding clients with setting their marketing and comms strategy, prioritising and focusing their digital marketing efforts with roadmaps and actionable plans.
Supporting and project managing the implementation.

-   Business development, sales & marketing - identifying opportunities to grow my

business and maintain a pipeline of clients
-   Collaborating with a network of expert freelancers to deliver a variety of specialist
marketing services for my clients
-   Managing all the operational aspects of running my own business!

JobTitle.Normalized: Global Operations Project AND Change Manager

Positions.Description:
Part of a brand-new function within the business of project & change specialists to deliver
project-based work for internal improvements as well as Client deliverables.

Some examples of my projects; 1) the creation of a model office for data, tech and ad ops
services for new clients, 2) the consolidation of programmatic capabilities & solutions
across agency brands, 3) leading the onboarding of a new global client account and

transitioning seamlessly from incumbent agency group.

Part of the management team involved in the transformation of DAN UK to become more
connected and easier to navigate; for both our people and our clients.

-   Enabling change & improvement to process and ways of working in order to

deliver the transformation.

-   Focusing on the use of tech & data, our people & resource, reducing cost & business growth opportunities
-   Developing target operating models for new functions, capabilities and service
lines; including ways of working and interactions inside & outside of the network, core processes and measures of success.


MARKETING & COMMS AND BUSINESS OPERATIONS

EXPERIENCE CONTINUED
Approachable, knowledgeable, highly-organised and efficient. A solid and in-depth
understanding of the business and our clients to be a positive force for change.

An example of a project delivered during the transformation: An improved approach to
reporting of digital media campaigns for clients. This involved the design of a suite of
product solutions to align with client needs and our internal resource to deliver. In order to do this, we delivered an element of standardization of output, automated the data
collection and engaged with technology partners to redesign our use cases.

- part of Dentsu Aegis Network

2015-2017
Amplifi is the media investment division of DAN with approx. 220 employees in the UK. I
was responsible for driving operational excellence and best practice for the agency,

reporting to the COO. Ensuring structure, process and systems & tech are fit for purpose

within the ever-changing digital media market:

Ad Tech & systems: ensuring we are getting the most out of our preferred technology
partners and embedding new solutions
Client focus: enabling medias team to deliver best in market media & technology solutions
for clients. Identifying client requirements & key questions to ensure we are best placed to deliver
Resource management: to ensure we are working to the optimum capacity across London
& Stafford offices and establish new approach to measuring effectiveness as we moved to agile and flexible working practices

Name.Raw: BMW, Burberry, Fox Entertainment and Microsoft
Name.Normalized: BMW Burberry Fox Entertainment and Microsoft

Positions.Description:
2013-2014

I was the lead for a team of 12 planner/buyers responsible for delivery of all digital
campaigns (display, programmatic, search & social) on behalf of Vizeum's clients - including
BMW, Burberry, Fox Entertainment and Microsoft.

- Ensuring progressive planning across display, programmatic, search & social.
- Responsible for client budgets and internal forecasts for income & revenue
- Accountable to Vizeum management and senior clients for best practice delivery
and client servicing from the team

Associations.Organization: Part of the Bloom UK network

Findings.Message: We found no EDUCATION HISTORY for the candidate. A resume should always include an education history section.
We detected that this document contained at least some data that was laid out as columns or tables. We rearranged that data to make it more usable. NEVER use columns or tables in a resume.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
The resume contains a contact information section that is not the first section. A resume should always include the candidate's contact info at the top of the resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
Every section should have text associated with it. This usually indicates an error with the section headers or format used in the resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.
